author: Courtney McBride
description: The Chinese military is in the midst of a “historic military buildup” that has made the US homeland “increasingly vulnerable,” according to the latest edition of a Pentagon report on the capabilities of the Chinese military, presenting a challenge to President Donald Trump’s plans for new limitations on US, Chinese and Russian nuclear arsenals.
title: China’s Military Buildup Makes US Vulnerable, Pentagon Report Says

description: Groundwork Collaborative Chief of Policy and Advocacy Alex Jacquez discusses the US economy and the Fed. He speak with Joe Mathieu on “Balance of Power.” (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Seeing K-Shaped Economy: Groundwork Collaborative's Jacquez

description: Rep. Jake Auchincloss (D-MA) speaks with Joe Mathieu on “Balance of Power” about the latest news from the Wall Street Journal that the US will be moving more troops into the Caribbean. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Rep. Auchincloss on Venezuela: This Is All About Oil

description: CATL flooded the domestic market with inexpensive, efficient batteries. It wants to do the same overseas, but European politicians—and Donald Trump—stand in its way.
title: China’s EV Battery Giant Is Trying to Find a New Road

author: Jen Judson
description: The Trump administration is sending about 350 Louisiana National Guard troops to New Orleans, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said, deploying military forces to another American city that has been the target of an immigration crackdown.
title: US Deploys 350 Troops to New Orleans As Crackdown Intensifies

author: Molly Smith
description: Economists say the shutdown will be a drag on the final months of 2025
title: Third Quarter GDP Soars, But US Consumers Remain Downbeat

description: Wall Street forecasts that US stocks are poised for another year of solid gains next year but several wildcards could disrupt the bullish narrative. Tatiana Darie has more. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Stocks May Get A Boost If Supreme Court Strikes Tariffs

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Caroline Hyde and Romaine Bostic discuss today's surprise GDP release pushing stocks higher during a holiday-shortened trading week. Bloomberg's Emily Graffeo joins the show to break it down. Also on today's show, Compass Chief Economist Mike Simonsen examines the real estate market as it sees a long-term post-pandemic shift. Plus, Ashley Global Retail CEO Chad Spencer discusses the furniture giant's new AI e-commerce assistant. Finally, FG Nexus Digital Assets CEO Maja Vujinovic on the outlook for cryptocurrencies in 2026, and Merk Investments CIO Axel Merk discusses gold and silver rising to new records on rate cut bets and global risks. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: GDP Surprise Pushes Stocks Higher  | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/23/2025

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s consumer confidence stayed above the neutral level for an eighth straight month in December, pointing to continued household optimism.
title: South Korea’s Consumer Confidence Remains Positive for 8th Month

description: The US economy expanded in the third quarter at the fastest pace in two years, bolstered by resilient consumer and business spending and calmer trade policies. Bloomberg's Emily Graffeo joined Caroline Hyde and Romaine Bostick on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break down the impacts of AI on the markets in 2026, consumer confidence data, and gains in mega-cap tech stocks. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: AI Still Major Theme for Investors Heading Into New Year

description: Chad Spencer, CEO of Ashley Global Retail, says that both online and in-store traffic is still strong as consumer do their holiday shopping. Spencer said that the company's partnership with PayPal and Perplexity AI is focused on making sure the buying experience is quick for consumers and meeting all of their needs.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Ashley Furniture, PayPal and Perplexity AI Build Shopping Platform

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court refused to let President Donald Trump start deploying National Guard troops in Chicago, dealing a setback to his drive to use the military in liberal cities across the country.
title: Supreme Court Rejects Trump Bid to Use National Guard in Chicago

description:
Gold and silver rallied to fresh all-time highs on escalating geopolitical tensions and prospects for more US rate cuts.
Gold prices are up more than two-thirds this year and are on track for its best annual performance since 1979, underpinned by elevated central-bank purchases and inflows into exchange-traded funds. Merk Investments President & CIO Axel Merk joined Caroline Hyde and Romaine Bostick on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Gold and Silver Rise to Records on Rate-Cut Bets, Global Risks

description: Democratic Representative from Vermont Becca Balint called for the full release of the Epstein files, telling Balance of Power that Americans should be able to see the documents to make determinations for themselves and that they can 'handle the truth.' Balint also addressed concerns that there are prominent democrats in the files, saying that she wants all of the information out, regardless of who it implicates. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Vermont Rep. Says 'Americans Can Handle the Truth' of Epstein Files

description: Saks Global Enterprises, facing limited options ahead of a more than $100 million debt payment due at the end of this month, is reportedly considering Chapter 11 bankruptcy as a last resort. The company is also weighing additional ways to shore up liquidity, including raising emergency financing or selling assets. Separately, some Saks lenders have held confidential talks in recent days to assess the company’s cash needs, according to reports. Bloomberg's Eliza Ronalds-Hannon joined "Caroline Hyde and Romaine Bostick on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Saks Mulls Bankruptcy After Raising Billions for Turnaround

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the Department of Justice releasing another wave of files related to Jeffrey Epstein. On today's show, Vermont Democratic Representative Becca Balint, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis and Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino, and Former Chairman of the House Financial Services Committee Patrick McHenry. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: DOJ Releases More Epstein Files | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/23/2025

description: The newest tranche of files related to Jeffrey Epstein show President Donald Trump flew on a private jet with him in the 1990s. The president said he never flew with the late financier. Laura Davison reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: New Epstein Files Say Trump Flew on Jet With Him

author: Taylan Bilgic, Siddharth Philip
description: Turkey lost contact with a Falcon 50 private jet flying from Ankara to Tripoli on Tuesday evening, Interior Minister Ali Yerlikaya said in a post on X. Five passengers were on board, including Libyan Armed Forces Chief of Staff Mohammed Ali Ahmed Al-Haddad, the minister said.
title: Jet Carrying Libya Military Head Disappears From Radar in Turkey

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: The Trump administration is halting $5.5 million in annual funding to Minnesota over allegations that individuals and businesses in the state committed fraud with government loans, according to a social media post from the US Small Business Administration.
title: Trump Official Pulls $5.5 Million in SBA Funds From Minnesota

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Donald Trump said he expects his Federal Reserve chair to lower interest rates if the economy is doing well, the latest signal that the president is eager for a nominee committed to borrowing cost cuts as he nears an announcement of his choice to replace Jerome Powell.
title: Fed Chair Should Lower Rates If the Market Does Well, Trump Says

author: Zachary R Mider, Jason Leopold
description: Law enforcement officials working on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation in 2019 referred to Leslie Wexner, the billionaire retail tycoon, as among 10 “co-conspirators” in the case, emails disclosed by the Department of Justice on Monday show.
title: Emails Cite Les Wexner, Ghislaine Maxwell Among Epstein's 'Co-Conspirators'

author: Ania Nussbaum
description: France is demanding action from the European Union in response to China’s decision to impose duties on European dairy products.
title: France Demands EU Action to Counter Chinese Duties on Dairy

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Ben Sasse, the former Republican senator from Nebraska, disclosed that last week he was diagnosed with metastasized, stage-four pancreatic cancer.
title: Former Senator Ben Sasse Says He Has Terminal Pancreatic Cancer

author: Liam Knox
description: The Trump administration will begin to seize student debt repayments from the wages of borrowers in default early next year, the US Education Department said Tuesday.
title: US to Begin Garnishing Wages for Student Debt Collection in 2026

author: Ania Nussbaum
description: The French National Assembly approved a stopgap budget law for 2026 to keep the state running into January after lawmakers failed to reach an agreement on the full fiscal plan.
title: France Adopts Stopgap Budget Bill Into 2026 to Avert Shutdown

author: Max Rivera
description: A California charter school operator has asked for permission to miss a financial cushion target required to cover its bond payments after enrollment slid at its mostly Hispanic campuses amid President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown.
title: Trump ICE Raids Crimp Revenue for California Charter School Debt

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkey increased the minimum wage by 27% for next year, broadly in line with inflation forecasts, in a sign policymakers remain committed to controlling price rises.
title: Turkey Raises Minimum Wage by 27%, in Line With Expectations

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: Since the Covid-19 pandemic, millions of Americans buying health insurance through Affordable Care Act (ACA) marketplaces have relied on enhanced subsidies to make their coverage more affordable. These tax credits, which lower monthly premiums, were designed both to ease costs for lower-income enrollees and to extend assistance to more middle-income households.
title: Why Obamacare Premiums Are Set to Rise Sharply

author: Ted Mann
description: On the campaign trail, Donald Trump wielded populist fury over the “Epstein files” as a cudgel against a corrupt and out-of-touch Washington elite that the president’s MAGA movement has long blamed for the country’s ills.
title: Trump Team’s Bungled Epstein Release Ensures Debate Will Rage On

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said he’ll invite the leaders of Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan as guests to the Group of 20 summit hosted in Miami next year.
title: Trump Invites Kazakh, Uzbek Leaders to G-20 Summit in Miami

author: Jordan Fabian
description: The US accused China of engaging in unfair trade practices in the semiconductor sector, but is declining to impose additional tariffs on chip imports until at least mid-2027.
title: US Holds Off on New Chinese Chip Tariffs Amid Trump-Xi Truce

author: Robb Mandelbaum
description: Proposed federal cuts could slash Pell grants, work-study, and support programs for low-income students.
title: Trump Loves Trade Schools. So Why Does He Want to Defund Them?

author: David Voreacos, Erik Larson
description: Federal prosecutors prepared an indictment of Jeffrey Epstein in 2007 that would have charged him with sex trafficking, and grand jurors heard months of testimony on the case, records from the Justice Department show.
title: Epstein Prosecutors Prepared Sex Trafficking Indictment in 2007

author: Oscar Medina
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro declared an ‘economic emergency’ after congress blocked his attempt to raise taxes.
title: Colombia Declares ‘Economic Emergency’ After Tax Rises Nixed

author: David Feliba, Manuela Tobias
description: Argentina wants to avoid selling bonds under New York law in January, Economy Minister Luis Caputo said on X, as anticipation for the country’s comeback to international debt markets continues to mount.
title: Argentina Will ‘Try Not to’ Sell Bonds in January, Caputo Says

author: Julian Lee
description: The amount of Russian oil on the water has swelled by almost 50% since the end of August
title: Russian Oil Stuck at Sea Booms as Tanker Logjams in Asia Expand

author: Sara Sjolin
description: Danish Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen said his country won’t bow to Donald Trump’s demand to hand over Greenland and summoned the US ambassador to explain his president’s comments.
title: Denmark’s Top Diplomat Tells Trump to Keep His Hands Off Greenland

author: Benjamin Bain
description: The US Justice Department released another tranche of files related to late, disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, as the Trump administration faces mounting pressure to comply with a new transparency law.
title: DOJ Releases Fresh Tranche of Epstein Files as Pressure Mounts

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italy’s Senate approved a budget for 2026, advancing legislation that will tame the country’s deficit along with a contentious amendment over the ownership of its gold reserves.
title: Italian Senate Passes Budget With Clause on Who Owns Rome’s Gold

author: Kevin Crowley
description: Trump has set back solar and wind while boosting fossil fuel, letting his fiercest critics claim the banner of energy affordability
title: In Fraught US Energy Fights, ‘All of the Above’ Is Now Democrats’ Pitch

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: The military junta is holding an election starting Sunday that many Western nations consider a sham.
title: Myanmar’s Generals Try to Exploit an Opening

author: Sanne Wass, Sara Sjolin
description: US President Donald Trump is dead set on taking control of Greenland, the world’s biggest island and a self-ruling territory of Denmark, despite opposition from Greenlanders and Danes.
title: President Trump Is Obsessed With Taking Over Greenland. Why?

author: Francesca Stevens
description: Vietnam’s Communist Party will nominate current General Secretary To Lam to stay in the top job, according to people familiar with the matter, paving the way for him to push on with a reform program that’s reshaping the nation.
title: Vietnam’s Communist Party Said to Back Lam to Remain as Chief

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Russian forces launched a missile and drone attack across Ukraine, killing civilians and hitting energy targets as negotiators pressed ahead with talks to end the nearly four-year war.
title: Ukraine Comes Under Widespread Russian Attack Amid Peace Talks

author: Kari Lundgren, Priscila Azevedo Rocha
description: Equinor ASA and Orsted A/S said they are engaging with US authorities over security concerns tied to their offshore wind projects, after the Trump administration issued another round of work suspension orders.
title: Equinor, Orsted Engaging With US Over Offshore Wind Suspension

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, President Donald Trump warned President Nicolas Maduro not to challenge the US and vowed to keep oil seized from a supertanker but declined to say if he’s seeking to oust the Venezuelan leader. 

Novo’s ADRs surged after the company won FDA approval to sell a pill version of its Wegovy blockbuster obesity drug, a crucial step in its effort to protect its market share from Eli Lilly.

Larry Ellison gives a $40 billion-plus guarantee to backstop Paramount’s bid for Warner Bros.
                                                                                                                  
Today's guest: DTEK CEO Maxim Timchenko. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Warns Maduro Not to Play ‘Tough’ But Won’t Threaten Ouster | Daybreak Europe 12/23/2025

description: President Donald Trump, speaking at a press conference at his Mar-a-Lago estate on Monday evening, warned Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro not to challenge the US and vowed to keep oil seized from a supertanker. The US stepped up its blockade of tankers going to and from Venezuela over the weekend. Bloomberg’s Brian Fowler reports.
title: Trump Warns Venezuela’s Maduro, Vows to Keep Tankers

author: Simon Marks
description: Kenyan authorities probing organized crime network involved in recruitment
title: Lured to Russia for Jobs, Hundreds of Kenyans Wind Up Fighting in Ukraine

author: James Mayger
description: A wave of visits to Taiwan by Japanese lawmakers is underway, underscoring the close ties between Tokyo and Taipei and drawing a sharp response from Beijing.
title: Flurry of Japan Lawmaker Visits to Taiwan Sparks China’s Anger

author: K Oanh Ha
description: An Indian manufacturer got big contracts with Mattel and Hasbro. Then Trump bumped levies to 50%.
title: Tariffs Unravel India’s Dream of Challenging China in Toymaking

description: In the first year of his second administration, Donald Trump and his advisers set the stage for the rerouting of trillions of dollars in capital in the US economy. Bloomberg's Allison McNeely explains. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Is Rerouting Trillions in Capital During His Second Term

author: Philip Aldrick
description: The UK could avoid a repeat of the damaging speculation that preceded Rachel Reeves’ budget by publishing the final pre-measures economic forecast, current and former members of the fiscal watchdog have suggested.
title: Avoid Budget Chaos by Releasing Pre-Policy Forecast, Reeves Told

author: Robert Burnson
description: President Donald Trump was sued for adding his name last week to that of Washington’s premier art venue — the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts — without approval from Congress.
title: Trump Sued by Kennedy Center Trustee for Renaming Venue

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim urged all parties to handle jailed former leader Najib Razak’s failed bid for house arrest with “full patience and wisdom,” after Monday’s court judgment tested ties within the ruling coalition.
title: Malaysia PM Anwar Calls for Calm After Najib Case Stirs Discord

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s central bank flagged growing financial vulnerabilities from surging home prices and currency weakness, even as the broader financial system remains resilient amid a recovering economy.
title: Bank of Korea Warns Won Volatility, Housing Boom Increase Imbalance Risks

author: Philip Heijmans, Khine Lin Kyaw
description: In August 2024, Myanmar’s ruling military junta was losing ground fast.
title: Myanmar Junta Seeks Legitimacy in Election Widely Seen as Flawed

author: Sakura Murakami
description: South Korea’s National Security Adviser Wi Sung-lac affirmed good ties with senior Japanese cabinet members during discussions held in Tokyo, ahead of a visit by President Lee Jae Myung to Japan expected early next year.
title: South Korea’s Wi Confirms Solid Japan Ties Ahead of Leader’s Visit

author: David Voreacos
description: A judge ruled that President Donald Trump’s administration must arrange for the return of a group of alleged Venezuelan gang members deported to a prison in El Salvador.
title: US Must Arrange Return of Deported Venezuelans, Judge Rules

description: "Balance of Power" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Former NATO Supreme Allied Commander for Europe, US Southern Command Former Commander in Chief Gen. Wesley Clark, Wedbush Securities Global Head of Tech Research Dan Ives, Harvard Kennedy School Belfer Center Director of Arctic Initiatives Jennifer Spence, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Harvard Kennedy School Ash Center Democracy Visiting Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Venezuela Blockade Intensifies; Health Care Fight Lingers | Balance of Power 12/22/2025

description: Rick Davis, Stonecourt Capital partner and Republican strategist, says the Heritage Foundation has shifted sharply toward a Trump-centric approach, moving away from its traditional Republican roots and, in his view, damaging its brand. Speaking on "Balance of Power" Democratic strategist Jeanne Sheehan Zaino of Harvard Kennedy School’s Ash Center added that there could be a potential challenge to JD Vance emerging within the party. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Heritage Foundation Shifts Toward Trump Mode: Rick Davis
